title: Director's Cut 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Reduced oak makes for an intense beginning. Then spicy acidity and plenty of earthy loam provide varietal character in this medium-bodied, textured wine.

title: Château de Gaudou 2015 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Still with its tannins firmly in place, this is a structured wine. It has a dry core surrounded by bold black fruits and kept in place with acidity. The wine, mainly Malbec with some Merlot added to soften will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Château du Cèdre 2014 Chatons du Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)
description: This crisp wine, flavored with black fruit is lightly tannic and deliciously full of lively fruit. It is full of juicy black-currant fruit and acidity with a soft texture that means it can be drunk now.

title: Château la Grave 2015 Expression Rosé (Minervois)
description: This Syrah-Grenache rosé is intensely herbal, with strong notes of thyme, sage, parsley, laurel and lavender, all grounded by a tart cherry character. The palate is pleasantly zippy in acidity and a touch astringent through the close, with notes of orange pith and melon rind that linger nicely. Drink now.

title: Agostina Pieri 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Dark berry, blue flower and French oak are some of the aromas you'll find on this. The bright, easygoing palate offers Morello cherry, vanilla and coffee alongside firm acidity and limber tannins.

title: Aila 2014 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Modest red-fruit aromas are edgy, spicy and a touch horsey. Lean and juicy in the mouth, this new Pinot Noir from Santa Ema tastes of plum and herbal raspberry. Dry, spicy and peppery tasting on the finish; true to the variety.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2015 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Generous, juicy and ripe yellow pears are boosted by some residual sweetness that is well balanced by the midpalate texture. Drink soon for maximum fruit.

title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Unoaked Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Punchy citrus aromas are natural like they should be for an unoaked wine. Angular and a bit sharp on the palate, this spunky style of Chardonnay deals tart peach and nectarine flavors in front of a fresh finish that's a touch sour.

title: Baron De Ley 2015 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Fruity aromas of peach, nectarine and cantaloupe are just dry enough. This feels fresh and a touch citric, with mild flavors of orange and nectarine. A gentle, slightly pithy tasting finish is a good ending to this everyday rosé.

title: Don & Sons 2014 Signature Series Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tar, baked blackberry and dusty, smoked oak define this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine that was aged in French oak, 85% of it new. The wood provides depth and breadth around velvety layers of juicy black-cherry pie and vanilla.

title: Dopff & Irion 2015 Cuvée René Dopff Riesling (Alsace)
description: The scent of fresh, bruised and baked apples makes for an enticing nose on this wine. Fresh and lively with lemon, the palate has a broader aspect than expected, with some graininess on the midpalate. It finishes dry and fresh.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2014 Riesling (Alsace)
description: Tart citrus fruit and earthy aspects unite in a taut, bright clean palate with a very clean-cut, dry finish.

title: Echeverria 2013 Gran Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)
description: Dry peppery currant and red-plum aromas are light and nothing you haven't come across before. Plum flavors are a touch baked, with a chocolaty backdrop. A solid finish with savory, spicy plum notes is satisfying.

title: Echeverria 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Generic but solid aromas of cassis and rubber lead to a basic palate with plum, currant, spice and herbal flavors. Drying tannins, a touch of toast and good overall balance define the finish.

title: McCall 2013 Unoaked Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: While unoaked, this tropical swirl of mango, guava and pineapple is unabashedly rich in style. Decadent caramel and butterscotch notes are a bit on the confected side but clean up tidily against a streak of sunny lemon on the mid palate. Drink through 2019.

title: McManis 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a generously fruity wine with light oak aromas, lots of straightforward black-cherry flavor, a smooth texture and full body.

title: Monte Volpe 2014 Vesuvius White (Potter Valley)
description: Light vanilla, macadamia and crisp apple flavors make this dry, medium-bodied wine a good blend of rich and lively.

title: Montemar 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Punchy citric aromas come with a note of fresh celery. This is zesty and crisp in the mouth, while orange and celery stalk flavors end with a refreshing, cleansing finish.

title: Marimar Estate 2013 Don Miguel Vineyard Earthquake Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an organically farmed block planted entirely to the Pommard clone, this wine offers strawberry, earth and black tea, diluted slightly by a tannic underbite that competes with the fruit. Softly structured, it grips further on the finish.

title: J. Lohr 2015 Wildflower Valdiguié (Monterey)
description: This is an immensely fun albeit simple, Beaujolais-like wine, best served chilled and on the beach or by a pool. Fairly dark in color, it shows deep blackberry, smoke, crushed graphite and a touch of tarragon on the nose, while the flavors offer Concord grape, plum, fruit punch and a touch of caramel.

title: River Road 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick, concentrated wine, full bodied in its toasty oak and bursts of cherry-vanilla. Oaky and soft, it possesses a funk of earthiness.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e Falcão (Wolf and Falcon) Red (Tejo)
description: The Alicante Bouschet and Castelão in the blend give it its rich, immediately fruity character and dense color. Structure and concentration leave room for an elegant texture. Blackberry juiciness shines at the end. Drink now.

title: Poggio Antico 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Subdued aromas of French oak, underbrush, espresso and menthol lead the way. The rather lean but polished palate offers tart sour cherry, vanilla and roasted coffee bean alongside vibrant acidity and firm tannins that grip the finish.

title: Vega Sindoa 2015 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Simple peach and melon aromas shine in this unoaked Chardonnay. A light-bodied palate holds apple and stone-fruit flavors before fading in to the short yet clean finish.

title: Vieil Armand 2015 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: An earthy hint comes with the bright lemon flavors of this dry, tart wine. The palate reveals a glimpse of riper fruit but lime freshness rules. It finishes totally clean.

title: Viña Otano 2015 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Dusty orange and nectarine aromas are on target. This is basic and citrusy in feel, with mild orange and stone-fruit flavors that fade quickly. A fresh finish isn't that flavorful but hangs around nicely due to healthy core acidity.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Synfandel Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose on this blend of Zinfandel and Syrah is a bit shy, with a touch of baked red cherry and hot asphalt. The palate is more intriguing, with stewed red cranberry, anise, brioche and cinnamon.

title: Tamarack Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of pear, apple, and whiffs of tropical fruit are followed by a tart lively palate full of rounded fruit flavors. It shows a light spritz and a lot of crispness.

title: Lieb 2014 Bridge Lane Red (New York)
description: Whiffs of black cherry, rose petal and spice scent this invigoratingly crisp red blend. It's satisfyingly full in body but impeccably balanced, offering taut black-cherry and plum flavors. Aged minimally in oak, there's not a lot of fuss or complication on the palate, but it's delightfully fresh and tasty. Drink now through 2019.

title: Gabarda NV 3 Red (Cariñena)
description: Fleshy cherry and lightly green, herbal aromas lead to a crisp, tight palate. This tastes a little leafy and herbal, with raspberry notes. The finish is fresh, dry, and composed, but not overly intense or focused.
